Hi all,

I wanted to run some questions by you and maybe get some pointers from the
architects of heritrix hoping I could save a little time before attempting
this.

What I am hoping to do is develop a custom writer to store the results of my
crawls in a distributed database, something like Riak, Cassandra, or HBase
for the Heritrix 3.0 code base.

I am very comfortable writing Java code and am very familiar with building
applications using the Spring Framework so I'm thinking this should be a
relatively easy task to get a proof of concept/prototype working.

Looking through the code I had some questions:

1.) It looks like I will wire in my custom code inside the DispositionChain,
essentially replacing where the warcWriter bean is referenced.

2.) Looking at the WARCWriterProcessor it appears it uses a pooled approach.
I'm guessing this is for performance reasons. Assuming I'm using a driver
which already implements connection pooling, are there any other
considerations I should think about while implementing my own Writer?

3.) Once I get my custom code developed, I assume all I need to do to make
it available to heritrix is to jar it up and just drop it in
$HERITRIX_HOME/lib - anything else I need to be aware of there?

Thanks,
-Zach

--0016364c7e37b53b1a04903d5e03
